sub_title: Freelance editor, proofreader and writer (Exactly Editing) - Writer and Speaker (Little Miss Sensitize)
summary:
For me, language makes the world go 'round, but understanding, support and transformation make the world a better place. This is why my working world is part language services, part life coaching. If you have need of either, please connect with me - let's communicate!

Experienced proofreader, editor and writer:
I have 7+ years of freelance experience, proofreading, editing and writing for a range of commercial, academic, organizational and individual clients. 
My clients work in an eclectic array of sectors/fields - including renewable energy, law, fiction writing, non-fiction writing, sustainability, public policy, education, psychology, the performing arts, and well-being. 
I have extensive editing and writing experience with technical documents, academic theses and dissertations, articles, manuscripts, and web copy. 
Testimonials and my client list can be found on my website: www.exactlyediting.nl

Trainee life coach:
After completing the CTI Co-Active Coaching Fundamentals Course in November 2021, via Schouten & Nelisse University of Applied Sciences, I am now taking on coaching clients. If you would like life coaching sessions, please send me a personal message to enquire.

For more information on any of the above, please request my CV. I would be happy to share it with you.

projects.title: “Valuable urban green space” provision: a study of how it is initiated and delivered by local authorities
projects.description:
Urban green space is “valuable” in different ways, many of which pertain to the concept of “sustainability”. However, the intangible nature of many urban green space “benefits” makes it difficult to place a “value” on the space in quantifiable terms.
The research looked at how two local authorities set about providing urban green space via two different approaches: i) a contemporary, spatial planning-related approach (green infrastructure, or GI); and ii) a more traditional (developer contributions-based) approach, in order to discover which mechanisms within each approach led to, or hindered, the provision of “valuable” urban green space. A “value typology” was compiled, which defined the scope of the research and helped to distinguish between the “benefits” that urban green space can offer (or the local authority planning objectives) and its resultant short-term and/or long-term “value” (or the local authority planning outcomes). An original research concept was devised, which was used as a tool for producing findings from data sourced from key documents and interviews with local authority actors and stakeholders in urban green space provision.

profile_positions.description:
I provide freelance editing, proofreading and writing services for a range of clients and sectors within and outside of Europe. My experience includes:
- 4+ years working with writers, authors and creatives, on fiction and non-fiction manuscripts, as well as web copy, blog posts and branding text
- 5+ years working with masters and PhD students, and other academics, on theses, dissertations, articles, papers and reports
- 15+ years working with engineers, scientists, policy advisers, financial experts and educators, on technical or official reports, for external and/or internal publication

Fields my current clients work in include:
- Environmental (especially renewable energy)
- Engineering 
- Academia (especially law, psychology, sociology, urban planning, and sustainability)
- Literary/Creative writing (especially fiction)
- Education (especially pre-school, early years and primary education)
- Urban design, planning and policy
- Creative arts (especially dance and music)
- Health and wellness 

My expertise is strongest when working with: 
- Technical and commercial reports
- Academic publications, theses, and dissertations
- Novel manuscripts
- Web and blog copy. 

I regularly use Word, Overleaf, PDF and PowerPoint, but am open to discussing new formats, where needed.

For a list of my clients and further information, please visit my website: www.exactlyediting.nl, or request a copy of my CV.
profile_positions.title: Owner - Editor, proofreader, writer, transcriptionist

profile_positions.description:
Highly sensitive people (HSPs), and the strengths we have in common, are everywhere – you just need to know how, when, where, and (most importantly) why to look for us/them.

Little Miss Sensitize's (LMS’) first goal is to help you recognise high sensitivity in yourself and in other people close to you, by sharing some of her own experiences and stories. She wants to start an ongoing conversation, and hopes that other HSPs will also share their own useful anecdotes, tips and resources.

LMS’ second goal is to show how high sensitivity, and the strengths which go along with it, can be used to improve everyone’s lives – by encouraging a new brand of confidence, counteracting negative messages, and elevating the advantages of being (or seeming) ‘different’.

If you are not highly sensitive, you are still a sensitive person (hardly any human beings are unsensitive), but you probably don’t experience things in the same way a highly sensitive person does. It is still worth finding out about the highly sensitive experience, as it may help you understand people who are important and/or close to you. And, this is the best bit…

… If you choose to, you can learn to access your own sensitivity strengths and/or borrow perspectives and approaches from HSPs. You can then use these to benefit yourself, and the people and communities around you. After a while, being more ‘sensitized’ becomes a way of life – and it makes for a good life, that’s a promise.

Visit https://littlemisssensitize.wordpress.com/ and see how...
profile_positions.title: Writer, Speaker, and Life coach

company.name: DNV GL - Renewables (formerly GL Garrad Hassan)

profile_positions.description:
Proofreading of technical reports for wind (onshore and offshore), solar, wave and tidal power projects across the world, including due diligence and energy assessment reports.

Proofreading of renewable energy strategy and policy advice notes and reports.

Initiation, compilation and development of an in-house grammar and style guide to assist with consistent report writing and presentation.

Research and reporting for the strategy and policy team.  

Ad hoc research of relevant (UK) planning aspects (IPC, CIL, relevant cases, etc.), to assist the strategy and policy team.
profile_positions.title: Technical Editor

profile_positions.description:
Ongoing work on a renewable energy and low carbon supplmentary planning document.
Work on green infrastructure issues in the district, with reference to the East Devon Growth Point Strategy.
Processing responses to the Core Strategy Preferred Approach consultation.
Assistance with local consultation events.
profile_positions.title: Planning policy intern (part-time)

profile_positions.description:
Website copy editing: reviewing the “West of England Carbon Challenge” (WECC) website portal.

Encouraging local businesses to participate in the WECC and assisting with various activities to support the “Sustainable Bristol City Region” initiative.

Representing Forum for the Future at local events, e.g. Bristol Harbourside Festival 2010.
